description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, children and adolescent rights have a sustained higher place in the public agenda and the private sector, informed by relevant and improved data, with enhanced adolescent participation

title.narrative: Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: Although from 2020 the pandemic halted the production of official statistics at the national level, UNICEF continued to produce information with a focus on the most vulnerable children. While most of the studies were national in scope, a few were conducted at the local level. UNICEF began to provide technical assistance to the National Institute of Statistics so it could include a focus on children in the official measurement of multidimensional poverty, publication of which would begin in 2022. The evaluation teams completed the three evaluations in the 2016–2020 programme cycle. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:21/12/2021
